item.description:
OK, let's make this an event so people can RSVP and coordinate carpools.

Please be sure to email Chado@mit.edu in advance to reserve your "zabuton". Actually, I'm not sure if there will be zabutons, so reserve your tatami space!

On September 30th, the MIT Japanese Tea Ceremony group is holding four sessions of tea ceremony at Showa Boston's Sanzashi-an. Each session is about 80 minute long and the schedule is as follows.

Sunday.September 30 2007
1)10:00-11:25am
2)11:30-12:55pm
3)1:00-2:25pm
4)2:30-3:10pm

Tickets are $15 per person (very cheap compared to the $30 rate at Kaji Aso Studio). In addition to the tea Japanese sweets will be served. Please try to show up in proper attire, nothing too fancy but do avoid jeans and T-shirts. For tickets email Chado@mit.edu. For more info about the event visit http://web.mit.edu/ch...

Unfortunately you will need a car to get to Showa. The school is located on 420 Pond st in Boston's coolest neighborhood, Jamaica Plain.
For directions visit http://www.showabosto...

To learn more about Japanese Tea Ceremony visit http://en.wikipedia.o...
Some more boring readings:
http://aabss.org/jour...
http://www.sg.emb-jap...
http://www.teahyakka....
item.name: Japanese Tea Ceremony at Showa Boston
